intro: Anemone × autanensis, commonly known as the hybrid anemone, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its showy, pink to white petals that resemble those of true anemones. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers bloom in early spring, adding a vibrant touch to gardens and natural landscapes. Anemone × autanensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in horticultural settings.
